article.Heading: Union Budget 2017-18: Govt cuts basic customs duty on LNG to 2.5%; IOC, BPCL gain
article.Summary: Finance Minister Arun Jaitley in his Union Budget 2017-18 has reduced basic customs duty on LNG from 5 percent to 2.5 percent.
article.Body:
Moneycontrol Bureau

Shares of BPCL, ONGC and IOC gained 1-2 percent intraday Wednesday as government has cut basic customs duty on LNG to 2.5 percent.

Finance Minister Arun Jaitley in his Union Budget 2017-18 has reduced basic customs duty on LNG from 5 percent to 2.5 percent.

The government has advanced the date of budget presentation so as to complete the entire process before the end of financial year.

At 12:58 hrs Indian Oil Corporation was quoting at Rs 372.25, up Rs 6.20, or 1.69 percent and Bharat Petroleum Corporation was quoting at Rs 684.35, up Rs 3.35, or 0.49 percent.

Posted by Rakesh Patil
